title: NASA Technology Soars at Selfridge Air Show
summary: NASA’s Glenn Research Center staff traveled to Michigan for the Selfridge Air National Guard Base air show, open house, and STEAM Expo, June 8 and 9. NASA’s Journey to Tomorrow, a 53-foot traveling exhibit, was a popular feature that showcased exploration in air and space. Additionally, experts from NASA’s Fission Surface Power project shared information on […]

title: Celebrate the Heliophysics Big Year with Free Heliophysics and Math Webinars from NASA HEAT
summary: The Heliophysics Big Year (HBY) is a global celebration of the Sun’s influence on Earth and the entire solar system. It began with the Annular Solar Eclipse on Oct. 14, 2023, continued through the Total Solar Eclipse on Apr. 8, 2024, and will conclude with Parker Solar Probe’s closest approach to the Sun in December […]

title: Spectral Energies is a NASA SBIR/STTR-Funded Tech that Could Change the Way We Fly
summary: Editor Note: Article written by Nicholas Mercurio With $20 million in commercial sales and $15 million in sales to government agencies, minority-owned small business Spectral Energies, based in Beavercreek, Ohio, has found a customer base for its pulse-burst laser systems. title: Space station startup Gravitics lands $125 million order from Axiom
summary: Washington-based startup Gravitics has signed a $125 million contract to expand Axiom Space’s planned space station, the latest deal in the burgeoning private market for orbiting habitats.

title: Maxar upgrades satellite imagery basemaps
summary: Maxar Intelligence’s new global basemap offers 15-centimeter imagery for metropolitan areas.

title: From Polar Peaks to Celestial Heights: Christy Hansen’s Unique Path to Leading NASA’s Commercial Low Earth Orbit Development Program
summary: Christy Hansen’s journey with NASA spans more than two decades and is marked by roles that have shaped her into a leader in space exploration. title: Ariane 6 set for maiden launch from French Guiana
summary: Europe’s new heavy-lift rocket, Ariane 6, is set for its maiden flight. Liftoff is expected to occur at the opening of a four-hour launch window on Tuesday, July 9, at 18:00 UTC, with the window extending to 22:00 UTC. Ariane 6 will fly from the Ensemble de Lancement Ariane-4 (ELA-4) launch pad at the Guiana Space Centre in Kourou, French Guiana.
